from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import pprint

# update pandas to make use of pandas.compare "result_names" parameter
%pip install -U pandas
import pandas as pd
source_dbtable = "load.SAP_HR_Leavers"

akv_name = 'pinskvsynwodwdevuks'
secret_name = 'sql-mipins-password'
kv_linked_service = 'ls_kv'
password = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecret(akv_name, secret_name, kv_linked_service)

# The servername is in the format "jdbc:sqlserver://<AzureSQLServerName>.database.windows.net:1433"
source_servername = "jdbc:sqlserver://pins-prod-pdac-sql.database.windows.net:1433"
source_dbname = "MiPINS-PRD-ISS"
source_url = source_servername + ";" + "databaseName=" + source_dbname + ";"
source_user = "kincarta" 
source_password = password
print(source_url)

%%pyspark
query = f"SELECT * FROM `odw_curated_db`.`{target_dbtable}`"
# target_df = spark.sql("SELECT * FROM `odw_curated_db`.`vw_mipins_fact_absence_all`")
target_df = spark.sql(query)
target_df = target_df.toPandas()

def sourcedata(source_dbtable):
        sourceData = spark.read \
                .format("com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.spark") \
                .option("url", source_url) \
                .option("dbtable", source_dbtable) \
                .option("user", source_user) \
                .option("password", source_password).load()

        source_df = sourceData.toPandas()

        return source_df

#### Dictionary of the mapping between source tables in MiPINS (left) and target tables in ODW (right)  

This can be added to manually and we can maybe keep a copy of this in storage to update independently of the notebook (future enhancement)

tablemapping = {
    "sap_hr.vw_fact_absence_all": "vw_mipins_fact_absence_all",
    "load.High_Court_Appeals": "vw_mipins_high_court",
    "live.dim_HR_work_contract": "vw_mipins_hr_contract",
    "live.dim_HR_cost_centre": "vw_mipins_hr_cost_centre",
    "load.SAP_HR_Leavers": "vw_mipins_hr_employee_leavers",
    "sap_hr.vw_fact_sickness": "vw_mipins_hr_fact_sickness",
    "Live.dim_HR_Gender": "vw_mipins_hr_gender",
    "Live.dim_HR_Organisation_Unit": "vw_mipins_hr_organisational_unit",
    "Live.dim_HR_personnel_area": "vw_mipins_hr_personnel_area",
    "Live.dim_HR_Personnel_SubArea": "vw_mipins_hr_personnel_sub_area"
}

print("Mapping created")
#### Test 1 - rows in source but not in target
#### Test 2 - rows in target but not in source
### Test 3 - source table row count
def count_source_table_rows(source_df):
return f'{len(source_df):,}'
source_df = sourcedata(source_dbtable)
count_source_table_rows(source_df)
#### Test 4 - target table row count
def count_target_table_rows(target_df):
return f'{len(target_df):,}'
count_target_table_rows(target_df)
rows_in_source_not_in_target(source_df, target_df)
rows_in_target_not_in_source(source_df, target_df)

#### Initial manually created dictionary of the source tables and test names  

This can be added to using the functions below
source_dbtable = next(iter(tablemapping))
target_dbtable = list(next(iter(tablemapping.items())))[1]

# Run test 1
# Define the source and target dataframes first
test_source_df = sourcedata(source_dbtable)
test_target_df = target_df
result = rows_in_source_not_in_target(test_source_df, test_target_df)

test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['target_table'] = target_dbtable
test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['test 1'] = result

pprint.pprint(test_result_dict)

# Run test 2
# Define the source and target dataframes first
test_source_df = sourcedata(source_dbtable)
test_target_df = target_df
result = rows_in_target_not_in_source(test_source_df, test_target_df)

test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['target_table'] = target_dbtable
test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['test 2'] = result

pprint.pprint(test_result_dict)

# Run test 3
test_source_df = sourcedata(source_dbtable)
test_target_df = target_df
result = count_source_table_rows(test_source_df)

test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['target_table'] = target_dbtable
test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['test 3'] = result

pprint.pprint(test_result_dict)

# Run test 4
test_source_df = sourcedata(source_dbtable)
test_target_df = target_df
result = count_target_table_rows(test_target_df)

test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['target_table'] = target_dbtable
test_result_dict[source_dbtable]['test 4'] = result

pprint.pprint(test_result_dict)

new_dict = test_result_dict
new_dict2 = next(iter(new_dict.values()))
new_dict2['test 3'] = ""
new_dict2

#### Function to add a new test to the test results dictionary

Pass a test name into the function and it sets the test result initially to "" (empty string)

#### Function to add a new source table to the test results dictionary

Pass the name of the new source table into the function and it will get added to the test results dictionary with the same values as the other source tables

# add a new test
add_new_test_to_result_dict("test 3")
pprint.pprint(test_result_dict)

# add a new source table
add_new_source_table_to_test_result_dict("my_new_table_2")
pprint.pprint(test_result_dict)
#### Show test results in a DataFrame

result_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(test_result_dict, orient="index")
# result_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(test_result_dict)
result_df.index.name = "Source Table"
result_df
#### Set the exit value of the notebook to the test results dictionary
mssparkutils.notebook.exit(test_result_dict)
